1.t: Woe to those who are fraudulent in (weighing and measuring),

2.t: those who demand a full measure from others

3.t: but when they measure or weigh, give less.

4.t: Do they not realize that they will be resurrected

6.t: when mankind will stand before the Lord of the Universe?

7.t: Woe to them! Let them know that the records of the sinner's deeds are in Sijin.
7.tr: Kallaaa inna kitaabal fujjaari lafee Sijjeen

8.t: Would that you knew what Sijin is!?

9.t: It is a comprehensively written Book (of records).

10.t: Woe, on that day, to those who have rejected God's revelations

11.t: and those who have rejected the Day of Judgment.

12.t: No one rejects it except the sinful transgressors
12.tr: Wa-maa yukazzibu biheee illaa kullu mu'tadin aseem

13.t: who, when listening to Our revelations, say, "These are only ancient legends".
13.tr: Izaa tutlaa 'alaihi aayaatunaa qaala asaateerul awwaleen

14.t: They will never have faith. In fact, their hearts are stained from their deeds.
14.tr: Kallaa bal raana 'alaa quloobihim maa kaanoo yaksiboon

15.t: On the Day of Judgment, they will certainly be barred from the mercy of their Lord.

16.t: They will suffer the heat of fire

17.t: and who will be told, "This is what you had called a lie".
17.tr: Summa yuqaalu haazal lazee kuntum bihee tukazziboon

18.t: However, the records of the deeds of the virtuous ones will certainly be in Illiyin.
18.tr: Kallaaa inna kitaabal abraari lafee'il liyyeen

19.t: Would that you knew what Illiyin is!

20.t: It is a comprehensively written Book (of records).

21.t: The ones nearest to God will bring it to public.

22.t: The virtuous will live in bliss,

23.t: reclining on couches, reviewing (the bounties given to them).

24.t: You can trace on their faces the joy of their bliss.

25.t: They will be given pure wine out of sealed containers

26.t: which have the fragrance of musk. This is the kind of place for which one should really aspire.
26.tr: Khitaamuhoo misk; Wa-fee zaalika falyatanaafasil Mutanaafisoon

27.t: With the wine is a drink from Tasnim,

28.t: a spring, the nearest ones to God will drink from it.

29.t: The sinners had been laughing at the believers.
29.tr: Innal lazeena ajramoo kaanoo minal lazeena aamanoo yadhakoon

30.t: When passing by them, they would wink at one another

31.t: and, on returning to their people, boast about what they had done.
31.tr: Wa-izan qalabooo ilaaa ahlihimun qalaboo fakiheen

32.t: On seeing the believers, they would say, "These people have gone astray".
32.tr: Wa-izaa ra-awhum qaalooo inna haaa'ulaaa'i ladaaal-loon

33.t: No one has appointed them to watch over the believers.

34.t: On the Day of Judgment, the believers will laugh at the disbelievers
34.tr: Fal-yawmal lazeena aamanoo minal kuffaari yadhakoon

35.t: while reclining on couches and reviewing (the bounties given to them).

36.t: Will not the disbelievers then be duly recompensed for their laughing at the believers?
36.tr: Hal suwwibal kuffaaru maa kaanoo yaf'aloon
